summary: This is an email chain from February 6, 2020, in which Nicholas Biase, the Public Information Officer for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, responds to a journalist's inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein and US/French international justice. Biase declines to comment, citing office policy against discussing non-public matters or granting interviews to prosecutors.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.role: Public Information Officer, U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the email, responding to a journalist's inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein. He states office policy prohibits discussing non-public matters or granting interviews with prosecutors.

persons.name: Phillipe Berry
persons.context: The recipient of the email, a journalist who submitted an inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein and US/French international justice to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the journalist's question regarding US/French international justice, mentioned in the email subject line.

connections.description: Biase is responding to Berry's journalistic inquiry regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Biase, as a Public Information Officer, is handling media inquiries related to the Epstein case.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York had a policy of not discussing non-public matters related to cases, including the Epstein case.
Prosecutors in the office were not available for interviews with journalists, whether on or off the record.
Media inquiries regarding the Epstein case were to be directed to the Public Information Officer, Nicholas Biase, or his colleague.
